thread.title: Manchester United will lose £85million if they fail to qualify for the Champions League this season
thread.title_full: Manchester United will lose £85million if they fail to qualify for the Champions League this season

author: dwright
title: Manchester United will lose £85million if they fail to qualify for the Champions League this season
text:
in the red Manchester United will lose £85million if they fail to qualify for the Champions League this season 
Missing out on Europe's top tournament for second year will hit United hard on and off the pitch By DUNCAN WRIGHT Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MANCHESTER UNITED stand to lose out on £85million if they fail to finish in the top four of the Premier League this season. 
The pressure is on Jose Mourinho to deliver Champions League football or United will be left with a massive hole in their finances. PA:Press Association 3 Manchester United are under pressure to finish in the top four or risk being hit financially 
United’s world record £750million kit deal with sportswear giants Adidas will be cut by 30 per cent under the terms of their ten-year deal. 
The contract has a clause which rules the Adidas commitment would drop massively if United fail to make it into the Champions League for two successive years. Reuters 3 Jose Mourinho know he has to deliver Champions League football or United will lose £85million 
That would mean United lose out on £22.5m on their kit deal alone, before the £60m TV revenue and prize money from being in the competition is taken into account. 
And according to the Mail, United’s board have also accepted they would have to reduce the VIP and hospitality season ticket prices to reflect the lack of Champions League football on offer. Sunday Premier League match preview featuring Leicester v Man Utd Getty Images 3 United know they have to try to move into the top four over the remaining three months of the season 
That reduction is being set at five per cent, adding a further £3m in lost revenue for the club. 
With manager Mourinho planning another summer of big investment, such a shortfall would be a problem for the United board who may find they operate at a loss for the first time in years.
